text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum for you
americans eat a lot of chicken and and
everyone seems to be buying those
boneless skinless chicken breasts and
oftentimes what happens is they end up
dry and overcooked just like this one
here well today i'm going to show you
how you can have your wonderful
flavorful moist chicken breast and
there's only one little trick to it and
that's in purchasing the chicken breast
so here in front of me I have bone-in
skin-on chicken breasts and the bone in
the skin what it does is it helps create
a really flavorful chicken breast and
also keeps the moisture inside so
purchase your breasts this way
season them up with a little bit of salt
and pepper and I have them on a wire
rack you can see and the best way to
prepare your chicken breasts is to roast
them in an oven so whenever we roast we
typically do it on a wire rack so that
there's even airflow and air circulation
around the meat so it helps to cook it
at a nice even rate and then these go
into the oven at 375 degrees for about
30 to 35 minutes until the internal
temperature of the chicken is 165 you
want to make sure that you don't go over
that temperature otherwise you are going
to have a dry chicken breast so into the
oven so our chicken breasts are out of
the oven
they've been resting for about 15
minutes tinted with tinfoil so that the
ekend breast don't get too cool and now
to serve your chicken breasts you can do
two things now if you're into the
boneless skinless breasts you can
certainly remove the skin from the top
so gently remove the skin from the top
of the chicken breast and this really is
a great method it does keep the chicken
super moist and it is really really
flavorful when you roast it on the bone
and now remove it from the bone just
gently glide your knife between the
chicken breast and the breast bone just
like that and now you can just slice
this into nice pieces you can use this
chicken on sandwiches you can use
and salads you could top pasta with it I
like to just serve this up simply with a
little bit of some fresh herbs some
watercress something like that maybe a
little bit of olive oil and if you
really like the skin like I do I would
serve this just the way I did before but
keeping the skin on so again it's gently
gliding your knife between the
breastbone and the chicken and again
just slicing it crosswise and this
method here you get a little bit of that
crispy skin with with every slice right
onto the plate a little bit of herbs so
there you have it a very simple way to
get the most delicious moist and
flavorful boneless chicken breasts enjoy
